title: Queer: A Collection of LGBTQ Writing from Ancient Times to Yesterday
description: LGBTQ writing from ancient times to yesterday selected by award-winning translator Frank Wynne.Drawing together writing from Catullus to Sappho, from Rimbaud to Ana√Øs Nin, and from Armistead Maupin to Alison Bechdel, translator Frank Wynne has collected a hundred of the finest works representing queer love by LGBTQ authors.Queer straddles the spectrum of queer experience, from Verlaine's sonnet in praise of his lover's anus and Emily Dickinson's exhortation of a woman's beauty, to Alison Bechdel's graphic novel of her coming out, Juno Dawson's reflections on gender and Oscar Wilde's 'De Profundis'.With stories, poems, extracts and scenes from countries the world over, Queer is an unabashed and unapologetic anthology, which gives voice to those often silenced.
author: Frank Wynne
